column4: Hi, I messed up pretty bad: chmodded sudoers and now sudo refuses to work cause sudoers is not 440. How can I modify the sudoers file without using sudo?
make a note of what is expected, boot to root recovery mode and set it, then stop messing with the file
sure, just run: sudo -i ,and you will be able to. Do as you wish
you can run all commands sans password til you type: exit
yes. You need to reboot to root recovery mode, like I said earlier
if you did you aren't running ubuntu. The first account you made is not. Root, its a user
ok then boot to root recovery and run: chmod o-w /etc/sudoers
I can't I need a root password, but once I'll get a root console, I should be OK
hold shift at boot, select recovery mode, then select root. You can then undo your mess
: for some reason, I need a password to drop to root console
then you set a root password which isn't needed or advised
you really are intent on destroying your. OS aren't you....
jrib knows some jiggery pokery. I recommend using liveCd and chrooting
yeah well I don't really want to destroy it, some stupid mistake I guess
you'll learn. You have a lot of work ahead
the sooner you forget root and stick to sudo, the easier life is
I never use root to be honest, It seems I may have once, but can't remember it
